column1: do you have any friends that have children:::propositionalQuestion
i do have friends that have children:::answer
and what do they say about finding adequate child care?:::setQuestion
i think that may be the key word:::inform
they're relatively nonexistent from what i hear from my friends:::inform

it seems like even when they have consulted day care centers that are reputable that are sort of like a chain if i can use that word still you have to deal with the people that happen to be operating it locally:::inform
it's just a matter of trust you know:::inform
i think they feel that these people are under qualified basically and  underpaid:::inform
i think that sort of goes hand in hand:::inform
we certainly found that to be true:::agreement
our children are now eleven and nine:::inform
we moved away from institutionalized child care:::inform
if we can call those chain kind of things like that uh by that name:::Inform
and found that more creative avenues were the right answer for us:::inform
at one point in time we've had au pairs:::inform
but adequate ones were really tough to find:::inform
they were really adequate ones were really:::selfCorrection
it takes that mixture of a very mature college student who wants to do something and yet is willing to give the time and the interest to the children:::inform
i do have a friend she and her roommate became live-in care givers:::inform
she and her roommate became live-in care givers:::inform
they had stayed with this family from the time these children were small four or five years old up until they were well into grade school:::inform
she was paid very well because the parents trusted them:::inform
they had done such a good job:::inform
so i can see where someone in a position like that in a live-in capacity would definitely be the way to go if you're lucky enough to have the financial  to be able to do that:::inform
and  that's something that we're struggling with now:::inform
i think it's just a matter of priorities:::inform
it's a terrible thing to say when you're speaking of children in that way:::inform
but  you still have to be realistic as well i think:::inform
much as other cultures disagree our lives don't revolve around our children:::inform
that's bad to have to admit too:::inform
but it's just there's so much pressure when you're talking about two people that work outside the home:::inform
i think that is one reason why i continue to be without children:::inform
when i've had friends that have said - when you hear people say:::selfCorrection
when you hear people say it alters your life forever please take heed <laughter>:::inform
if i can  )  the other side of the coin for a moment:::request
it is such an honor and a thrill to be a parent that most of the time it's worth it:::inform
i just have to be honest about it:::inform
there are those times when i think gee  if i didn't have children i could be out playing  )  or golf:::inform
i had a friend that said before we always said we don't want children because we can't go off on the spur of the moment or this or that and the other:::inform
she said we never do those things anyway:::inform
it's just the way your attitude changes:::inform
but the thing about the child care i have friends that struggle financially and they both do have to work:::inform
it's a matter not necessarily that she might want to stay home or he as well:::inform
but you know  they need the money:::inform

and when i seen some of my friends that have taken that six week old baby you know to someone else it's just i can imagine how emotional  it must be and multiplied by the fact that you don't really trust the person  or you're uncomfortable with the situation as far as child care:::inform
we were lucky when our children were that age:::inform
having lived in a community for a while we knew the person to whom we were entrusting our children:::inform
and felt that feeling of safety:::inform
we also learned something from that experience as our children got older:::inform
it's that care givers are not omniscient:::inform
they are not all things to all people:::inform
the ones that are good with babies tend not to be good with toddlers:::inform
i think your patience level needs to increase as the child gets older <laughter>:::inform
i think that might be part of the problem with some people you know:::inform
taking care of a baby i know is not an easy thing:::inform
but when you have them in their little feet are moving:::inform
you have to chase them down constantly:::inform
i'm sure that's a whole new ball game:::inform
i have a nine year old that i would trade happily for a baby:::inform
you sound like you're pretty well passed the worst of it as far as worrying about:::inform
worrying about since they're both in school you don't have to worry about:::selfCorrection
since they're both in school you don't have to worry about a full-time person to take care of them  <<voices fading in and out>>:::inform
you don't know what happens after they get in school:::inform
now we have one takes piano lessons:::inform
the other one of course can't do the same thing:::inform
it has to be somewhere else:::inform
and  no  it's not adequate to sit and wait:::inform
that's just the way their minds work:::inform
the stamina that you must draw from yourself to deal with it:::inform
i guess you find out that you're a much stronger person than you thought maybe:::inform
i've been finding out that i really am a nice person:::inform
now it's just a reservoir that you tend to regularly i'm sure:::inform
do you feel comfortable with them coming home after school until you and your wife get home:::propositionalQuestion
i mean one of them i would leave unsupervised any time any place any where:::inform
the other one i wouldn't leave unsupervised two minutes:::inform
that's just a difference in kids i suppose:::inform
it's the one that's going downhill:::inform
is it the one that needs more supervision that has a bad influence on the older or more mature one:::propositionalQuestion
you don't think you don't think:::stalling
you don't think that good prevails:::checkQuestion
i'm living in a dream world:::inform
as i said i don't have kids:::inform
so  i've never been around children:::inform
so i'm sort of at a loss where that's concerned:::inform
but i do hear my friends talk about it:::inform
my wife and i were both only children:::inform
we just couldn't wait to have two children so they would be such friends:::inform
<laughter>  that's like world war three every minute <laughter>:::inform
i have to admit i was selfish as a child:::inform
i didn't want a brother or sister:::inform
now that i'm older of course it's different:::inform
i think about wouldn't it be nice:::inform
my best friend is one child of ten:::inform
they just sort of adopted me as their eleventh child:::inform
so that worked out pretty well:::inform
she never had to worry about taking anybody to child care because there was always somebody there older to deal with them:::inform
so i guess that's an alternative:::inform
if you could just have a whole bunch <laughter>:::inform
by the time the youngest ones are there you'll have older one to take care of them:::inform
when you see all these horror stories on television about child care:::inform
i was seeing something on the television earlier about a little girl that's been telling her mother these terrible stories:::inform
of course people are denying it:::inform
what's frightening is a parent to see things that you don't really don't understand:::inform
and then  you don't really know what happened:::inform
we gave up on one baby sitter because we came home one night and found pieces of ribbon:::inform
